metrics.baseline: Paper that describes the base model

goals.description: Increased number of visits to the garden

system.task: Identify flowers in pictures taken at the garden
system.usage_context: The model will be part of an application, the Garden Buddy app, that runs on a device loaned out by a botanical garden so that visitors can identify flowers during their visit.

risks.fp: Poor user experience due to incorrectly identified flowers
risks.fn: Poor user experience due to inability to identify flowers
other: Wrong results due to unknown flowers
Users do not like the results due to strange behavior.

fields.name: Phylum
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below kingdom and above Clade 1.

fields.name: Clade1
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Phylum and above Clade 2.

fields.name: Clade2
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Clade 1 and above Clade 3.

fields.name: Clade3
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Clade 2 and above Order.

fields.name: Order
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Clade 3 and above Family.

fields.name: Family
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Order and above Subfamily.

fields.name: Subfamily
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Family and above Genus.

fields.name: Genus
fields.description: The taxonomic rank below Subfamily and above Species.

model.deployment_platform: Model will be deployed as part of the Garden Buddy App on a small device loaned out to garden visitors.
model.capability_deployment_mechanism: The model will expose an API that will be called from the flower identification application.

input_specification.name: flower-picture
input_specification.description: Path to the picture of the flower taken at the garden
input_specification.expected_values: String corresponding to a valid path to a picture in PNG format

output_specification.name: flower-number-for-lookup
output_specification.description: Number of the flower identified in the picture, which is used as a lookup number for a table that contains the identified flower information. This table is derived from the training data.
output_specification.expected_values: Either flower number between 0 and 102, or -1 to indicate that it could not identify the flower.

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden
system_requirements.response: Regardless of the location in the garden, the model can correctly identify the correct flowers
system_requirements.measure: at least 90% of the time

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden, and it is a bit blurry. ImageMagick will be used with different levels of blur introduced to the origional flower test data set to simulate the operational images taken
system_requirements.source: the by the Garden Buddy application
system_requirements.response: The model successfully identifies flowers
system_requirements.measure: at the same rate as non-blurry images, as measured using the Wilcoxon Rank-Sum test, with significance at p-value <=0.05.

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden, and it is a bit blurry. ImageMagick will be used with different channel loss introduced to the origional flower test data set to simulate the operational images taken
system_requirements.environment: normal operations. These devices are known to sometimes lose a channel (i.e., RGB channel)
system_requirements.response: The model successfully identifies flowers
system_requirements.measure: at the same rate as full images, as measured using the Wilcoxon Rank-Sum test, with significance at p-value <=0.05.

system_requirements.stimulus: The model running on the loaned device receives pictures taken at the garden
system_requirements.environment: normal operations. The loaned devices are small, inexpensive devices with limited CPU power, as well as limited memory and disk space (512 MB and 150 MB, respectively)
system_requirements.response: The model executes on the loaned device
system_requirements.measure: without any errors due to unavailable resources

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden
system_requirements.response: The application indicates main features that were used to recognize the flower, as part of the educational experience.
system_requirements.measure: The app displays the original image highlighting the most informative features in flower identification, in addition to the flower name

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden
system_requirements.response: The model identifies the flower correctly
system_requirements.measure: with an accurayc of at least 90%

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden
system_requirements.response: Model correctly processes inputs and produces outputs
system_requirements.measure: according to established input and output specifications without exceptions

system_requirements.stimulus: The ML pipeline receives a picture taken at the garden that does not conform to the input specification
system_requirements.response: The model does not process the input
system_requirements.measure: and instead the ML pipeline produces -99 as the output and creates a log entry with the tag "Model - Input Validation Error - <Input>, where <Input> is the original input.

system_requirements.stimulus: The ML pipeline receives a picture that corresponds to an OOD input
system_requirements.response: The model will process the input
system_requirements.measure: and the ML pipeline will create a log entry with the tag "Model - Input OOD Error - <Input>, where <Input> is the original input

system_requirements.stimulus: The ML pipeline detects an output distribution change
system_requirements.source: the output produced by the model
system_requirements.response: The ML pipeline will create a log entry
system_requirements.measure: with the tag "Model - Output Confidence Error - <Output>, where <Output> is the output produced by the model that triggered the condition

system_requirements.stimulus: Model running on the loaned device receives a picture
system_requirements.response: The time for the model to return an output
system_requirements.measure: is no more than two seconds

system_requirements.stimulus: The model receives a picture taken at the garden, simulated by using the test data set,
system_requirements.response: The results over 50 test data sets, each with 500 randomly selected test samples
system_requirements.measure: will be compared using Kruskal-Wallis test will be used to evaluate if similarity of class of model results, with p<0.05

system_requirements.stimulus: The ML component will periodically need to be retrained in which 10 sampled training data sets will be used to generate a new trained ML component,
system_requirements.response: The performance of the model, as measured on the same test data set,
system_requirements.measure: using a Friedman test will be used to evaluate if similarity of class of model results, with p<0.05

system_requirements.stimulus: The Garden Buddy application may be used in a VR environment, and as such the ML component may receive synthetic flower images
system_requirements.response: Comparing the results of the application on the origional flower test data set and the new synthetic test data set,
system_requirements.measure: should show no signifigant differences in performance on performance will be assessed using ANOVA on each label set, with significance at p-value < 0.05

system_requirements.stimulus: ML component will transition from the development environment through integration with the operational ML enabled system
system_requirements.response: The new ML component, post integrated into the ML-enabled operational system
system_requirements.measure: should have test set results differ by less than 0.25% when comparing results to those obtained in the development environment.

system_requirements.stimulus: A new developer is joining the Garden Buddy team
system_requirements.response: The implementation and design choices are easily understood by a new developer after reading the code and documentation
system_requirements.measure: after 2 person/days

system_requirements.stimulus: A new flower is introduced into the garden
system_requirements.source: the garden staff updating the garden and hosting traveling botanical exhibits
system_requirements.response: A new trained ML component, trained on updated training data and number of output labels,
system_requirements.measure: will be available no later than 8 hours after the development team is notified.

system_requirements.stimulus: The need for the app to run with a new input format for the ML component
system_requirements.source: the operations/maintenance team needs to changing input data processing pipelines as a new device type is used for the Garden Buddy app
system_requirements.response: The new sensor's data input  processing pipeline is to replace the old input data processing pipeline
system_requirements.measure: and the total effort involved is less than 4 hours of operations staff time.

system_requirements.stimulus: The team needs to quickly change the ML model being run by the application
system_requirements.source: as an advancement in the field has occurred that necessitates an update in the algorithm used to generate the ML component
system_requirements.response: The model switch change over is made
system_requirements.measure: and the total effort involved is less than 16 hours of development and operation teams' time

system_requirements.stimulus: The ML component needs to be retrained
system_requirements.source: as an environment necessitating a new model has occured
system_requirements.response: The development team kicks off the ML model retraining process
system_requirements.measure: and the total personnel time devoted to kick off, monitoring and checking the output of the retraining process is no more than 1 hour.

system_requirements.stimulus: The decision to produce a new app, with only changing who it is marketed to, user interface, and platform is issued
system_requirements.response: The existing garden buddy ML component is used in the new app
system_requirements.measure: with limited changes to the ML component code were needed to integrate the ML component into the new app, totaling no more than 1/2 a development day.
